mdRecord.dcterms:title: Microscope in case
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Monocular brass microscope with tweezers stored in a wooden box. The microscope belonged to Edward Anderson Holmes (fils), a student at UVa in 1890. He lived on the Lawn in Pavilion VI with his uncle, George Frederick Holmes, a professor at UVa. The donor is the grand niece of E.A. Holmes. She gave the microscope in honor and memory of E.A. Holmes and G.F. Holmes.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
Donated by Barbara Ann Holmes Stoudt [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments or apparatus
